topic_or_construct: human sequential decision making (optimal stopping behavior)
justification: "Participants performed 200 trials of the ticket-shopping task" in which their accept/reject choices across 10 sequential ticket prices were recorded to study how they make stopping decisions.

topic_or_construct: human sequential decision making in real-world settings
justification: Experiment 3 introduced a "realistic optimal stopping task" where participants searched through ten sequential product prices, providing data on when they stopped and accepted a price.

The authors "propose that people rely on a mental shortcut and adapt their thresholds linearly" and demonstrate that the LTM "accurately captures when people stop search and accept an option," using its fitted parameters as the measure of internal thresholds.
